qas.question: What is commemorated on January 22 in Ukraine?

answers.text: in front of St. George's Cathedral.

context: In Ukraine, Lviv and Kiev celebrated <a0_0>Ukrainian Independence Day<a0_0/> on January 22, 1989. Thousands gathered in Lviv for an unauthorized moleben (<a1_0>religious service<a1_0/>) <a2_0>in front of St. George's Cathedral.<a2_0/> In Kiev, 60 activists met in a Kiev apartment to commemorate the proclamation of the Ukrainian People's Republic in 1918. On February 11–12, 1989, the Ukrainian Language Society held its founding congress. On February 15, 1989, the formation of the Initiative Committee for the Renewal of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church was announced. The program and statutes of the movement were proposed by the Writers Association of Ukraine and were published in the journal Literaturna Ukraina on February 16, 1989. The organization heralded Ukrainian dissidents such as Vyacheslav Chornovil.
